titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Alice Cox Wood was the wife of the Rev. Charles Wood.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of travel scrapbooks from Mrs. Wood's extensive travels around the world and in the United States. Scrapbooks include letters home to family and friends, illustrated with photographs, postcards, drawings, maps, and newspaper clippings. The letters consist mostly of descriptions of sights, people, architecture, and modes of travel. There are a few mentions of missions and occasional extracts of reports or addresses on missionary activities. The collection also includes negatives from Wood's travels.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Wood family papers (accession 90 1010).
